cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi WSW of Negril, Jamaica and 130 mi SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest, expected to cross western Cuba Friday and then accelerate across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cayman Islands and Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, Havana, Artemisa, Pinar del Rio, and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, with greatest risk from east Texas to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: 30% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt or higher) beginning late Sunday, gusts 40–55 mph possible if the track shifts east
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Alabama coast, higher if the center tracks farther east
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain Monday into Tuesday with localized higher amounts, leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and dangerous rip currents well ahead of the center
